concept.title: Formatting hashes and keys in public-key cryptography

titlealts.navtitle: Formatting hashes and keys in public-key cryptography
titlealts.searchtitle: (): Formatting hashes and keys in public-key cryptography

concept.shortdesc: The and verbs support several methods for formatting a hash and, in some cases, a descriptor for the hashing method, into a bit-string to be processed by the cryptographic algorithm.

conbody.p: This section provides information about the ANSI X9.31 and PKCS #1 methods. The ISO 9796-1 method can be found in the ISO standard.
This section also describes the PKCS #1, version 1, 1.5, and 2.0, methods for placing a key in a bit string for RSA ciphering as part of a key exchange.
